episodeTitle: The Beginning of the War! Ace and Whitebeard's Past!
description: Whitebeard reveals his devastating earthquake powers as the battle at Marineford begins. Through flashbacks, we witness how Ace rose from captain of the Spade Pirates to becoming Whitebeard's Second Division Commander, and the tragic events that led him to pursue Blackbeard against orders.

events.title: Whitebeard Reveals His Earthquake Powers
events.description: Whitebeard demonstrates the full might of the Gura Gura no Mi by creating massive quakes in the air, sending shockwaves through the atmosphere. The Marines witness firsthand why he's called the Strongest Man in the World.
events.significance: First full display of Whitebeard's legendary Devil Fruit powers at Marineford, establishing the scale of power in this war and why the Marines fear him so much.

quotes.text: I'm Whitebeard! Let's begin this war!
quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Whitebeard's declaration before revealing his power

events.title: Whitebeard Creates Twin Tsunamis
events.description: Using the Gura Gura no Mi, Whitebeard creates two massive tsunamis on both sides of Marineford, threatening to destroy the entire Marine headquarters. The waves tower over the island as Marines watch in horror.
events.significance: Demonstrates the world-ending potential of Whitebeard's Devil Fruit and the scale of destruction possible in this war. Shows why the Gura Gura no Mi is considered the strongest Paramecia.

events.title: Aokiji Freezes the Tsunamis
events.description: Admiral Aokiji uses his Hie Hie no Mi powers to freeze the massive tsunamis created by Whitebeard, preventing the destruction of Marineford. He demonstrates the power of an Admiral by countering Whitebeard's attack.
events.significance: Shows that the Marines have the power to counter even Whitebeard's devastating abilities. Demonstrates the scale of power among the world's strongest fighters.

events.title: Flashback: Ace as Captain of the Spade Pirates
events.description: The episode flashes back to reveal Ace's past before joining the Whitebeard Pirates. He was the captain of his own crew, the Spade Pirates, and had already made a name for himself in the New World.
events.significance: Provides crucial backstory on Ace's journey and establishes his credentials as a powerful pirate in his own right before becoming Whitebeard's son.

events.title: Spade Pirates Debut
events.description: The Spade Pirates, Ace's original crew before he joined the Whitebeard Pirates, appear for the first time in a flashback. The crew shows their loyalty to Ace as their captain.
events.significance: Introduces Ace's first crew and shows his leadership abilities before joining Whitebeard. Adds depth to Ace's character and history.

events.title: Ace Declined Becoming a Warlord
events.description: It's revealed that Ace turned down an invitation from the World Government to become one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea, choosing instead to seek out Whitebeard.
events.significance: Shows Ace's independence and ambition. His refusal of a Warlord position demonstrates he had bigger goals and wasn't interested in working with the World Government.

events.title: Ace vs Jinbe Five-Day Battle
events.description: Ace confronts Jinbe, a Warlord of the Sea and protector of Whitebeard's territory, in order to reach Whitebeard. The two fight for five days straight with neither able to defeat the other.
events.significance: Demonstrates Ace's incredible strength and endurance, being able to fight a Warlord to a standstill for five consecutive days. Establishes respect between Ace and Jinbe.

quotes.text: I won't let you pass! Whitebeard is my savior!
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Jinbe defending Whitebeard's territory from Ace

events.title: Whitebeard Defeats the Spade Pirates
events.description: After the five-day battle between Ace and Jinbe ends in a draw, Whitebeard himself appears. He easily defeats the exhausted Spade Pirates crew, demonstrating the vast difference in power.
events.significance: Shows Whitebeard's overwhelming strength and establishes the hierarchy of power in the One Piece world. Sets up Ace's journey to join the Whitebeard Pirates.

quotes.text: You who challenged me should step forward!
quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Whitebeard calling out Ace after defeating the Spade Pirates

events.title: Ace's Assassination Attempts on Whitebeard
events.description: After being defeated, Ace repeatedly attempts to assassinate Whitebeard, trying over and over to kill him in his sleep or through surprise attacks. Each attempt fails as Whitebeard easily deflects or ignores them.
events.significance: Shows Ace's stubbornness and pride, as well as Whitebeard's patient, fatherly nature. This establishes the foundation of their father-son relationship.

events.title: Ace Accepts Whitebeard as His Father
events.description: Over time, Ace stops trying to kill Whitebeard and instead comes to respect and love him as a father figure. He fully embraces being part of the Whitebeard Pirates family.
events.significance: Crucial character development for Ace, showing his transformation from a lone wolf to someone who found a family. Explains the deep bond between Ace and Whitebeard.

events.title: Ace Becomes Second Division Commander
events.description: Whitebeard promotes Ace to become the Second Division Commander of the Whitebeard Pirates, one of the highest positions in the crew. This shows Whitebeard's complete trust in Ace.
events.significance: Establishes Ace's important position within the Whitebeard Pirates and shows how far he's come from being a defeated enemy to becoming one of Whitebeard's most trusted sons.

events.title: Ace Meets Shanks
events.description: In a flashback, Ace meets with Shanks to thank him for saving Luffy's life and to discuss his little brother. This meeting shows the connection between these powerful figures.
events.significance: Connects Ace's storyline to Luffy and Shanks, showing Ace's gratitude for Shanks saving his brother. Demonstrates the respect between these powerful pirates.

quotes.text: Thank you for saving my little brother.
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace thanking Shanks for saving Luffy

events.title: Flashback: Blackbeard Murders Thatch
events.description: The flashback reveals how Marshall D. Teach (Blackbeard) murdered Thatch, the Fourth Division Commander, to steal the Yami Yami no Mi Devil Fruit. This act violated the most sacred rule of the Whitebeard Pirates: never kill a crewmate.
events.significance: This murder is the inciting incident that led to Ace pursuing Blackbeard, which ultimately resulted in Ace's capture and the War at Marineford. One of the most important events in the series.

events.title: Ace Decides to Pursue Blackbeard
events.description: Against Whitebeard's direct orders to let Blackbeard go, Ace takes responsibility for Blackbeard's actions as his division commander and leaves to hunt down and capture the traitor.
events.significance: This decision is the single most important choice in Ace's life, leading directly to his capture, the War at Marineford, and ultimately his death. Whitebeard's reluctance to let him go foreshadows the tragedy to come.

quotes.text: Let me go after him, Pops. Teach was part of my division. I'm responsible.
quotes.speaker: Ace
quotes.context: Ace asking permission to pursue Blackbeard

events.title: Whitebeard Takes Full Responsibility for Ace
events.description: In the present at Marineford, when Ace asks why Whitebeard came to save him despite his disobedience, Whitebeard responds that it was he who told Ace to go, taking full responsibility as a father.
events.significance: Demonstrates the depth of Whitebeard's love for Ace as a son. This moment crystallizes their father-son relationship and explains why Whitebeard would risk everything to save Ace.

quotes.text: I told you to go. I'm the one who ordered you to go after Teach!
quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Whitebeard taking responsibility for Ace's pursuit of Blackbeard

themes.description: The episode explores the deep bonds of chosen family through Whitebeard and Ace's relationship. Whitebeard's willingness to wage war to save Ace demonstrates the strength of familial love beyond blood.
themes.symbolism: Whitebeard calling his crew his 'sons' represents the power of chosen family over biological family, especially significant given Ace's complicated relationship with his blood father, Gol D. Roger.

themes.description: Ace's decision to pursue Blackbeard stems from his sense of responsibility as Second Division Commander and his pride. This pride ultimately leads to his capture, showing how personal honor can sometimes conflict with wisdom.
themes.symbolism: Ace's repeated assassination attempts on Whitebeard symbolize his initial inability to accept help or family, which he eventually overcomes.

themes.description: Both Whitebeard and Ace demonstrate different aspects of leadership - Whitebeard's protective fatherly leadership versus Ace's responsibility-driven leadership. Whitebeard taking blame for Ace's actions shows true leadership.
themes.symbolism: The massive tsunamis Whitebeard creates symbolize the overwhelming power and responsibility that comes with his position as the strongest man in the world.

characterSpotlights.development: The episode reveals Whitebeard's patient, fatherly nature through flashbacks showing how he accepted Ace's assassination attempts without retaliation and eventually earned his loyalty and love.

mangaDifferences.difference: Animation error: When Ace meets Shanks in the flashback, Shanks is shown with both arms intact. However, Shanks lost his left arm saving Luffy years before this meeting took place. This was corrected in the home release.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first time Whitebeard's signature laugh 'Gurarara' is heard in the anime.
The Gura Gura no Mi is stated to be the strongest Paramecia-type Devil Fruit, with the power to destroy the world.
The five-day battle between Ace and Jinbe demonstrates both characters' incredible stamina and power, putting them at similar levels before Ace joined the Whitebeard Pirates.
This episode adapts content from manga chapters 551 (pages 17-19) and 552 (pages 2-15).
